alert.note: Alert for Posey; Vanderburgh (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 02 at 12:37PM EST until January 12 at 11:41AM EST by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Paducah KY has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Indiana...Kentucky... Ohio River at Mount Vernon. .Recent heavy rains in the Ohio River basin are expected to cause the river to rise above flood stage at Shawneetown this week. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY MORNING THROUGH WEDNESDAY, JANUARY 12... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Ohio River at Mount Vernon. * WHEN...From Tuesday morning to Wednesday, January 12. * IMPACTS...At 40.0 feet, Farm land and some main roads are flooded in places southwest and west of Mt. Vernon. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:00 AM CST Sunday the stage was 28.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late Tuesday morning to a crest of 40.3 feet early Sunday afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage Wednesday, January 12. - Flood stage is 35.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 40.2 feet on 04/09/2014. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
